parsed.internal_thinking: My first settlement at Node 41 provides Ore (O5), Wheat (Wh9), and Brick (B10). For my second settlement in this setup round, my primary goal is to diversify my resource production to acquire Wood and Sheep, which are essential for building more settlements and roads. I analyzed various available nodes, considering their resource yields and numbers, as well as adherence to the distance rule. Initially, I considered nodes adjacent to my first settlement or its road (Node 31). Node 31 offers Wheat, Brick, and Wood (Wh9, B10, W11), which would give me Wood but still leave me without Sheep. Other nodes like 19 seemed promising for Wood, Brick, and Sheep (W11, B10, S8), but upon closer inspection, Node 20 (a neighbor of 19) is occupied by Player B, making Node 19 unavailable due to the distance rule. After a thorough scan of the board for nodes providing Wood and Sheep, I identified Node 13. Node 13 is adjacent to Hexes 6 (W3), 3 (W4), and 2 (S5). This combination provides both Wood and Sheep with decent production numbers (3, 4, 5). Placing a settlement here would give me W, W, S, which, when combined with my existing O, Wh, B from Node 41, completes my set of all five basic resources (Wood, Brick, Sheep, Wheat, Ore). This comprehensive resource base is crucial for early game development, allowing me to build more settlements, roads, and potentially cities or development cards as the game progresses. Node 13 is currently unoccupied and adheres to the distance rule, as none of its adjacent nodes (12, 14, 5) or their neighbors are occupied by any player's settlements. After placing the settlement at Node 13, I will place an accompanying road. An optimal road placement from Node 13 would be to Node 12. Node 12 (W3, B6, S5) offers access to additional Wood, Brick, and Sheep, providing a strong potential future expansion point or trade leverage.
parsed.note_to_self: My second settlement at Node 13 (W3, W4, S5) successfully completes my resource diversity with Wood and Sheep, complementing my first settlement's Ore, Wheat, and Brick. This gives me all five resources needed for early game building. My road will connect 13 to 12. Next turn, I should focus on accumulating resources for building more roads to expand towards high-value hexes or a port, or to upgrade my settlements to cities.
parsed.say_outloud: Alright, time for my second settlement! I'm securing a spot that gives me a good spread of resources to kickstart my growth.
